content: The "Senior Professional Performance Act of 2008" establishes pay provisions for senior-level positions, including locality pay adjustments. The maximum applicable level is set at level III of the Executive Schedule for specified positions. The "Senior Professional Performance Act of 2008" amends clauses and subparagraphs related to senior-level positions, including adding a new position under section 5376. The "Senior Professional Performance Act of 2008" amends clauses related to senior-level positions by updating references in clause (ii) to include paragraph (1)(C) and adding the option of (vii) in addition to (vi). The "Senior Professional Performance Act of 2008" updates clauses for senior-level positions, including adjustments to maximum rates of basic pay based on performance appraisal systems certified under section 5307(d). The "Senior Professional Performance Act of 2008" updates clauses for senior-level positions, including adjustments to maximum rates of basic pay based on performance appraisal systems certified under section 5307(d). Title 5, United States Code is amended to provide authority for employment, appointments, and classification standards within agencies. The "Senior Professional Performance Act of 2008" updates clauses for senior-level positions, including adjustments to maximum rates of basic pay based on performance appraisal systems certified under section 5307(d). The Director of the Office of Personnel Management will prescribe necessary regulations for implementation. Effective date for amendments is set to take effect on the first day of the first pay period following the 180th day after enactment, with no reductions in rates of pay. The amendments made by the "Senior Professional Performance Act of 2008" ensure that there are no reductions in the rate of basic pay for individuals holding positions under section 5376 of title 5, United States Code. The rate of basic pay will be determined based on the rate set under section 5376, plus any applicable locality pay, subject to regulations by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management. References to maximum rates under section 5376 of title 5, United States Code are clarified. Before the effective date of the amendments, it refers to the rate of basic pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule. After the effective date, it refers to the rate of basic pay for level III of the Executive Schedule, unless certified otherwise by the head of the agency. The certification criteria for meeting level II of the Executive Schedule under section 5307(d) are outlined. Limitations on certain payments are amended to require a certified performance appraisal system for meaningful distinctions based on relative performance. The certification period for an agency's performance appraisal system shall not exceed 24 months unless extended by the Director of the Office. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management may extend the certification of a performance appraisal system without additional justification, with a limitation on the extension expiring by June 30, 2009 or the first anniversary of the date of the original certification. The Director of the Office of Personnel Management may extend the certification of a performance appraisal system without additional justification, with a limitation on the extension expiring by June 30, 2010 or the second anniversary of the original certification. The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of enactment of this Act.
